intro: Hieracium symphytaceum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are often heart-shaped. Its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and it is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. Hieracium symphytaceum is known for its ability to spread through rhizomes and is considered a weed in some agricultural settings.
